wikipedia_page.main: Dame Mary Kathleen Cheshire,  (née Lloyd; 31 May 1902 — 3 April 1972) was a director of the Women's Royal Naval Service (WRNS). She was born in Eastbourne, East Sussex

response: He married Burella Primrose Eleanor Barstow, daughter of Lieutenant Colonel Thomas Anderson Adam Barstow, on 6 February 1915. They had two children: (Geoffrey) Leonard Cheshire and Christopher Cheshire, who was also a wartime pilot. In 1963, a year after the death of his first wife, Geoffrey Cheshire married Dame Mary Lloyd (1902–1972), daughter of A.J. Lloyd, and a former Director of the WRNS. Geoffrey Cheshire outlived his second wife as well, and died in 1978, aged 92.

link_mentions.page: List of Dames Commander of the Order of the British Empire
response: *1952: Florence Bevin, Kathleen Courtney, The Viscountess Davidson, Mary Lloyd, Marjorie Maxse
* Mary Lloyd (Royal Navy officer)  (1902–1972), director of the Women's Royal Naval Service (WRNS)
* Mary Merrall, actress who may have been born Mary Lloyd
* Mary Lloyd Jones (born 1934), Welsh printmaker and artist
